intro: Casearia myrsinoides, commonly known as the waxleaf casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a small, spherical berry that turns red when mature, attracting various bird species.
